topic.title: Complete List of Synopsys Bridge Arguments

body.p: The tables below lists Synopsis Bridge CLI commands and arguments used with Synopsys Bridge for different workflows.
In all cases, access tokens and sensitive information should be passed as environment variables (set BRIDGE_BLACKDUCK_TOKEN=<TOKEN>).

section.title: Polaris

section.title: Black Duck
section.p: The base command to run the scan:synopsys-bridge --stage blackduck

entry.p: Accepts true or false. (Default: false). If True, Synopsys Bridge would run Full / Intelligent scan. Typically used for push to main (used in creating Fix PRs).
Path to directory where detect.jar is available.
Used by Bridge to determine whether to break the build or not.
If provided, Bridge will break the build (Return with exit code 8), if the current scan results in issues with severity as provided by user in this field.
(SCM Information needed for Fix PR is listed in table below )

Accepts true or false (Default: false). If true, Synopsys Bridge turns on Fix PR feature. Synopsys Bridge attempts to generate PRs for all vulnerable components found in the scan. Requires full scan to be run. This flag is ignored if run with Rapid Scan. Fix PR is available only for NPM projects. User must pass token and scm information needed to generate PRs. If set to false, Synopsys Bridge turns off the Fix PR feature.

Accepts true or false (default: false).If true, Synopsys Bridge turns on PR Comments Feature. Bridge attempts to add comments on the PR for new issues introduced in the PR. Requires Rapid Scan to be run. This flag is ignored if Full scan is run. If false, PR Comments feature is turned off.

section.title: Coverity Connect
section.p:
The base command to run the scan:synopsys-bridge --stage connect
Argument Input Mode Required Notes
Command Line Argument Environment Variable JSON field
URL coverity.connect.url BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_URL coverity.connect.url Yes
User Name coverity.connect.user.name BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_USER_NAME coverity.connect.user.name Yes For security reasons it is best to pass this as an environmental variable.
Password coverity.connect.user.password BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_USER_PASSWORD coverity.connect.user.password Yes For security reasons it is best to pass this as an environmental variable.
Project Name coverity.connect.project.name BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_PROJECT_NAME coverity.connect.project.name Yes Project must exist on Coverity Instance
Stream Name coverity.connect.stream.name BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_STREAM_NAME coverity.connect.stream.name Yes Stream must exist on Coverity Instance.
View coverity.connect.policy.view BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_POLICY_VIEW coverity.connect.policy.view No
Coverity platform's view name/ID.
Bridge uses this information to break the build by returning exit code 8 if issues are found in the view provided by user.
PR comments coverity.connect.automation.prcomment BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_AUTOMATION_PRCOMMENT coverity.connect.automation.prcomment No
Default: false. This flag enables PR commenting for Connect workflow. If set to true, Synopsys Bridge attempts to add comments on the PR for new issues introduced in the PR. If set to false, the PR Comments feature is turned off.
Install directory coverity.install.directory BRIDGE_COVERITY_INSTALL_DIRECTORY coverity.install.directory No
Default: ($HOME)/.bridge/coverity. Directory where Synopsys Bridge downloads the thin client to run scans.
local analysis coverity.local BRIDGE_COVERITY_LOCAL coverity.local No
Default: false. This field allows users to use Synopsys Bridge with Coverity Connect. If true, Synopsys Bridge attempts to download full analysis kit, and not just the thin client. Synopsys Bridge then triggers analysis locally using Coverity CLI. This flag is needed for a traditional Coverity Connect Instance.
If false, Synopsys Bridge attempts to download Coverity Thin Client. Synopsys Bridge then uses the Coverity Thin Client to schedule and run analysis in the cloud. Used this option for CNC instances.

When used with Coverity Connect, Synopsys Bridge can download full analysis tools and run analysis locally using Coverity CLI. Once analysis is complete, Coverity CLI pushes results to the server. In order to run local analysis, pass an additional argument: coveriy.local=true
Pass coverity.connect.user.name and coverity.connect.user.password as environmental variables (BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_USER_NAME and BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_USER_PASSWORD) for security reasons.
You can input this file with a synopsys-bridge --stage connect --input input.json command.

section.title: Universal Synopsys Bridge Arguments
section.p: These arguments can be passed on the command line, but not as part of a JSON file.

row.entry: The --stage command specifies a group of adapters to run (such as --stage polaris).
The --input command loads a JSON file containing common arguments to run scans
Required for inputting a JSON files.
Shows the help file for Synopsys Bridge.
Outputs JSON format logs. See Logging and Diagnostics.
Outputs JSON format logs in the bridge.log file in the Synopsys Bridge home directory. See Logging and Diagnostics.
Specifies a specific version of Synopsys Bridge to run.

Enables debug logs under the Synopsys Bridge home directory. Creates a diagnostics.json file containing the final state data inside the Synopsys Bridge home directory, but masking sensitive information like tokens and passwords. See Logging and Diagnostics.

section.title: Integration Specific Arguments
section.p: If bridge_coverity_automation_prcomment, bridge_blackduck_automation_prcomment or bridge_blackduck_automation_fixpr are set to true, you must also pass the appropriate scm_token with the required permissions. (Example: azure_token: $(System.AccessToken).)
